column2: A centralized state is important for the liege to grow powerful, but a decentralized state might be easier to maintain.
column3: Un état centralisé apporte un pouvoir grandissant au seigneur, mais un état décentralisé est plus facile à entretenir.
column4: Ein zentralisiertes Reich begünstigt den Machtzuwachs des Lehnsherrn, doch ein dezentralisiertes Reich könnte leichter zu handhaben sein.
column6: Para el señor feudal es importante un estado centralizado para incrementar su poder, pero un estado descentralizado puede ser más fácil de mantener.

column2: Enact new policies in all nations where you rule by decree, increasing the power of the central government.
Enact new policies in all nations where you rule by decree, decreasing the power of the central government.
You decide to rule for life the government of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName].
Show decisions allowing you to make unilateral decisions about the government of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName].
Hide the decree menu to free up space on your decision list.
has not changed a Constitutional Law in 10 years.
This character changed a Constitutional Law some time within the past 10 years, and cannot change another until this modifier expires.

Rulers are elected by a federal council consisting of the previous ruler, their immediate superior, and all major regional governors. In practice, the new ruler will almost always be a member of the electoral council or a relative of the previous ruler.
column3: Les dirigeants sont élus par un conseil fédérale composé du dirigeant précédent, son supérieur immédiat, et tous les principaux gouverneurs régionaux. En pratique, le nouveau dirigeant sera toujours un membre du conseil éléctoral du précédent dirigeant.

column2: Rulers are elected by popular vote.
column3: Les dirigeants sont élus par vote populaire.

column2: Rulers are nominally elected by popular vote. In practice, a handful of wealthy families monopolize the political process.
column3: Les dirigeants sont théoriquement élus par vote populaire. Dans la pratique, une poignée de riches familles monopolisent le milieu politique.

column2: Rulers are elected by a federal council, but only members of a specific ruling family are eligible for election.
column3: Les dirigeants sont élus par un conseil fédéral, mais seuls les membres d'une famille régnante spécifiques sont elligibles.

column2: Managing an interstellar state, with populations that can be numbered in the trillions, is a difficult task. Most such states grant broad autonomy to local governments for practical reasons if nothing else, but some attempt to form a strong centralized government.
This state is less of a state ad more of a loose military alliance. There is a central government, but it is almost completely powerless.
Member-states are required to obey the central government in the most critical matters, such as military and diplomatic duties, but are still granted almost completely autonomy in domestic issues.
This state's central government and local governments are roughly equal in prestige and power.
This state's local governments are allowed some rights and autonomy, but this is mostly honorary.
This state has a single legitimate central government. Local governments serve only administrative purposes and have no authority to pass their own laws.
The general principles used to determine how military commands and offices are assigned.
Military commands are hereditary, and may be passed down from parent to child.
Military officers are elected from among their subordinates or by the citizens of the territory they defend.
Military officers are appointed by their immediate superiors.
The general principles used to determine how military commands and offices are assigned.
Military commands are hereditary, and may be passed down from parent to child.
Military officers are elected from among their subordinates or by the citizens of the territory they defend.
Military officers are appointed by their immediate superiors.
The general principles used to determine how local civilian governors are selected.
Local civilian governments are led by hereditary rulers.
Local civilian governments are led by officials elected by the general population.
Local civilian governments are led by officials appointed by the central government.
The general principles used to determine how local civilian governors are selected.
Local civilian governments are led by hereditary rulers.
Local civilian governments are led by officials elected by the general population.
Local civilian governments are led by officials appointed by the central government.
The general principles used to determine how local administrators are selected.
Administrative centers and shrine worlds are led by hereditary rulers.
Administrative centers and shrine worlds are led by officials elected from among the local populace.
Administrative centers and shrine worlds are led by administrators or priests appointed by the central government.
The general principles used to determine how local administrators are selected.
Administrative centers and shrine worlds are led by hereditary rulers.
Administrative centers and shrine worlds are led by officials elected from among the local populace.
Administrative centers and shrine worlds are led by administrators or priests appointed by the central government.
The length of time each leader holds power between elections.
column3: La durée pendant la quelle le dirigeant détient le pouvoir entre deux éléctions.
Les dirigeants détiennent le pouvoir pendant quatre ans avant qu'un autre ne puisse être élu.

column2: Leaders hold power for four years before a new leader must be elected.
column3: Les dirigeants détiennent le pouvoir pendant quatre ans avant qu'un autre ne puisse être élu.

column2: Leaders hold power for six years before a new leader must be elected.
column3: Les dirigeants détiennent le pouvoir pendant six ans avant qu'un autre ne puisse être élu.

column2: Leaders hold power for ten years before a new leader must be elected.
column3: Les dirigeants détiennent le pouvoir pendant dix ans avant qu'un autre ne puisse être élu.

column2: Leaders hold power for life or until they are removed by a vote of no confidence..
column3: Les dirigeants gardent le pouvoir à vie ou jusqu'à ce qu'ils soient démis de leurs fonctions…

column2: The length of time each leader holds power between elections.
column3: La durée pendant la quelle le dirigeant détient le pouvoir entre deux éléctions.
Les dirigeants détiennent le pouvoir pendant quatre ans avant qu'un autre ne puisse être élu.

column2: Leaders hold power for four years before a new leader must be elected.
column3: Les dirigeants détiennent le pouvoir pendant quatre ans avant qu'un autre ne puisse être élu.

column2: Leaders hold power for six years before a new leader must be elected.
column3: Les dirigeants détiennent le pouvoir pendant six ans avant qu'un autre ne puisse être élu.

column2: Leaders hold power for ten years before a new leader must be elected.
column3: Les dirigeants détiennent le pouvoir pendant dix ans avant qu'un autre ne puisse être élu.

column2: Leaders hold power for life or until they are removed by a vote of no confidence..
column3: Les dirigeants gardent le pouvoir à vie ou jusqu'à ce qu'ils soient démis de leurs fonctions…

column2: What kind of Legislature that exists.
Although this state has a legislature, the ruler decide who are members of it.
The members must be nobility or other kind of landed citizens, concentrating power in the hands of the few.
The power is in the hands of the people, anyone can be elected.
The members of the Soviet must be chosen only among the common workers, landowners and nobility are not allowed.

A form of legislature appropriate for military organizations, it is composed of active and retired officers, with civilians prohibited from even attending the sessions that are considered military secrets.

Whether or not the government is able to enforce its control over its subordinates. Civil Order is automatically set to Weak whenever a civil war or revolt breaks out against the government, and can only be restored to Strong by a sufficiently powerful government.

The government has little de facto control over its territory, and local governors are largely autonomous. Vassals may wage private wars within the realm and out of the realm, and local militias cannot be relied upon for support.
The government is steady. Vassals cannot wage autonomous wars within the realm, but can wage external wars.
The government is strong and steady. Vassals cannot wage autonomous wars within the realm, for fear of a swift and strong reprisal from the capital.
Whether this government subsidizes or taxes its military vassals, and by how much.
This government heavily subsidizes its military vassals.
This government lightly subsidizes its military vassals.
This government neither subsidizes nor taxes its military vassals.
This government lightly taxes its military vassals.
This government heavily taxes its military vassals.
Whether this government subsidizes or taxes commerce, and by how much.
This government neither subsidizes nor taxes commerce.
Whether this government subsidizes or taxes religious colonies, research centers, and administrative centers, and by how much.
This government heavily subsidizes religious colonies, research centers, and administrative centers.
This government lightly subsidizes religious colonies, research centers, and administrative centers.
This government neither subsidizes nor taxes religious colonies, research centers, and administrative centers.
This government lightly taxes religious colonies, research centers, and administrative centers.
This government heavily taxes religious colonies, research centers, and administrative centers.

The portion of your budget spent on enforcing the law and public order in your systems. Even notorious criminals occasionally find it necessary to hire public enforcers in order to keep some semblance of peace.
This government does not fund any sort of state police force, relying purely on local government to maintain law and order.

This government funds a light state police force, which enforces law and order in both major cities and interplanetary space.
Grants the following effects in all owned, unoccupied systems:
§Y*§! Local tax modifier -0.05
§Y*§! Local revolt risk -0.1
§Y*§! Civil unrest growth slowed to one half

This government funds a sizable state police force, which enforces law and order in both major cities and interplanetary space.
Grants the following effects in all owned, unoccupied systems:
§Y*§! Local tax modifier -0.1
§Y*§! Local revolt risk -0.2
§Y*§! Civil unrest growth slowed to one quarter

This government funds a large, well-equipped state police force, which spares no expense in enforcing the law.
Grants the following effects in all owned, unoccupied systems:
§Y*§! Local tax modifier -0.2
§Y*§! Local revolt risk -0.3
§Y*§! Civil unrest growth slowed to one eighth
The police force in the [This.GetName] System is no longer funded.
The police force in the [This.GetName] System now receives low funding.
The police force in the [This.GetName] System now receives moderate funding.
The police force in the [This.GetName] System now receives high funding.
There is a small, lightly funded police force in this system, which enforces public order in major settlements and in interplanetary space.
There is a significant, well-funded police force in this system, which enforces public order in major settlements and in interplanetary space.
There is an enormous, extremely well-funded, and well equipped police force in this system, which enforces public order in major settlements and in interplanetary space.
The portion of your budget spent on providing basic health care services to your citizens. Strong health care spending will allow a system to better resist exotic and alien diseases.
This government lacks any public health care system, leaving matters entirely in the hands of the private sector.

This government funds a small state health care service.
Grants the following effects in all owned, unoccupied systems:
§Y*§! Local tax modifier -0.05
§Y*§! Disease resistance 0.25

This government funds a sizable state health care service.
Grants the following effects in all owned, unoccupied systems:
§Y*§! Local tax modifier -0.1
§Y*§! Disease resistance 0.5

This government funds a large state health care service, capable of easily responding to and neutralizing potential epidemics.
Grants the following effects in all owned, unoccupied systems:
§Y*§! Local tax modifier -0.2
§Y*§! Disease resistance 0.75
Public health care in the [This.GetName] System is no longer funded.
Public health care in the [This.GetName] System now receives low funding.
Public health care in the [This.GetName] System now receives moderate funding.
Public health care in the [This.GetName] System now receives high funding.
The portion of your budget spent on educating your citizens. A higher education budget will encourage the spread of scientific knowledge and technology.
This government lacks any public education system, leaving matters entirely in the hands of the private sector.

This government provides basic education services to its citizens, but education is only lightly funded.
Grants the following effects in all owned, unoccupied systems:
§Y*§! Local tax modifier -0.05
§Y*§! Tech growth modifier 0.05

This government funds a sizable public education service.
Grants the following effects in all owned, unoccupied systems:
§Y*§! Local tax modifier -0.1
§Y*§! Tech growth modifier 0.1

This government funds one of the finest public education systems in known space.
Grants the following effects in all owned, unoccupied systems:
§Y*§! Local tax modifier -0.2
§Y*§! Tech growth modifier 0.15
Education in the [This.GetName] System is no longer funded.
Education in the [This.GetName] System now receives low funding.
Education in the [This.GetName] System now receives moderate funding.
Education in the [This.GetName] System now receives high funding.
Civil unrest will grow in the [This.GetName] System.
Civil unrest is growing in the [This.GetName] System.
Civil unrest will be reduced in the [This.GetName] System.
Civil unrest is weakening in the [This.GetName] System.
The vast majority of this system's population respects and supports their government, but there are nevertheless a number of malcontents.

This system's government has the support of most of the population, but there is a noticeable anti-government minority. This is not a serious problem, but it could become one if left unchecked. Civil unrest is often driven by economic depression, the perceived failure of government, or severe ideological differences.

This system's government is controversial, and there is a growing anti-government activist movement, but its population still respects the government's authority. This is not a serious problem, but it could become one if left unchecked. Civil unrest is often driven by economic depression, the perceived failure of government, or severe ideological differences.

This system's government is unpopular, and there is a significant anti-government activist movement, but its population still respects the government's authority, for now. If something is not done soon, the government may lose the ability to enforce law and order. Civil unrest is often driven by economic depression, the perceived failure of government, or severe ideological differences.

This system's government is unpopular, and there is a significant anti-government activist movement with a growing radical wing. If something is not done soon, the government may lose the ability to enforce law and order. Civil unrest is often driven by economic depression, the perceived failure of government, or severe ideological differences.

This system's government is unpopular, and it is beginning to lose control of the population. While law and order is still maintained in most of the system, it has begun to break down in outlying and isolated communities. Civil unrest is often driven by economic depression, the perceived failure of government, or severe ideological differences.

This system's government is deeply unpopular, and it is beginning to lose control of the population. While law and order is still maintained in the capital and major population centers, the government has essentially lost control of many colonies and space stations. Civil unrest is often driven by economic depression, the perceived failure of government, or severe ideological differences.

This system's government is  deeply unpopular, and it is no longer respected by the population. Law and order is still maintained in the capital and most of the major population centers, but only by brute force, and now even some major cities are in a state of anarchy. Civil unrest is often driven by economic depression, the perceived failure of government, or severe ideological differences.

This system's government is extremely unpopular, and its control of the population is on the verge of collapse. The majority of the system is in a state of anarchy, and government forces have retreated to fortified enclaves within the major population centers. Civil unrest is often driven by economic depression, the perceived failure of government, or severe ideological differences.

Law and order have completely collapsed in this system, and the government has fled into hiding or exile. No centralized authority is recognized, and law and order, such as it is, is maintained only by local citizens' militias. Civil unrest is often driven by economic depression, the perceived failure of government, or severe ideological differences.

Rulers are elected by a council consisting of the previous ruler and other clans. In practice, the new ruler will always be a clan leader. But beware: a kingdom can fragment easily is the new ruler is weak, too young or without prestige.
column3: Les dirigeants sont élus par un conseil fédérale composé du dirigeant précédent, son supérieur immédiat, et tous les principaux gouverneurs régionaux. En pratique, le nouveau dirigeant sera toujours un membre du conseil éléctoral du précédent dirigeant.

column2: This is a decision all governments with a legislative body must make, a trade-off between efficiency, passing laws faster and cheaper, or representation, allowing more accurate knowledge of the population wishes, giving more stability and legitimacy.
In this form of legislative body, all decisions are made by a small council composed by the Executive advisors and ministers.
Popular with small states, military juntas and theocracies, this is a proper legislative body, although often still appointed by the ruler and being almost as if they were co-ministers.
Also called with a variety of other names, like Supreme Council, National Council and so on, these tend to be the actual legislative bodies separate from the Executive functions.

The first non-tribal legislative bodies in human civilization were the assemblies, one of the earliest ones being the Athenian Ekklesia, that translates to Assembly in english. This body has real power, but might still be too small to represent enormous populations.

Aiming to give the most representation possible within what is practically possible, this form of government body has been rather popular since year 1800 or so, with some countries having a quite sizeable number of members, the 2020 session of the National People's Congress of China having 2980 seats.
Enacting this, means the ruler is going to disobey his liege laws, if he has one, and also any crown laws that may apply to him, even ones of his own government.
The Executive intends to obey the laws.
The Executive intends to ignore the laws.
The purpose of this law is define if the government leader will be military, civil or rectorial.
A military government has the main seat in a fortress or military base and the ruler is also the commander of the armed forces.

Civil governments are when the military is despite having their own commander, are subservient to civilian leadership, the seat of such government is usually some kind of city or town, and its focus is providing public services to its population.

The leaders of this type of government are called Rectors, traditionally a Rector is whoever controls some kind of institution, could be an Abbey, University, Monastery or Research Institute. The focus of these types of government tend to be philosophical, advancing knowledge, sciences, religion or ideological ideas.
Large enough governments will be too inefficient keeping themselves too narrow, this law allows a government to expand its scope, or keep itself focused.

If combined with a civil government, this government becomes a imperialistic government, where the ruler controls both civil service and the military, such governments tend to be expansionist, needing further conquest to fuel their bureaucracy.\nIf combined with a rectorate, this government becomes a theocracy, where the main purpose of the government is to spread its ideas and have a population that also follow such ideas.

If combined with a military government, this government becomes a imperialistic government, where the ruler controls both civil service and the military, such governments tend to be expansionist, needing further conquest to fuel their bureaucracy.\nIf combined with a rectorate, this government becomes a technocracy, where the government is ruled by specialists seeking to enhance the state with wealth, technology and knowledge.

If combined with a military government, this government becomes a theocracy, where the main purpose of the government is to spread its ideas and have a population that also follow such ideas.\nIf combined with a civil government, this government becomes a technocracy, where the government is ruled by specialists seeking to enhance the state with wealth, technology and knowledge.
